intro: Siparuna davillifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian jasmine, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical, glossy leaves and produces small, red berries that are edible for birds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
